dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.cbe.policy.appli.server.PolicyExecutionPoint
dataStructure.description:
A PolicyExecutionPoint is an entity that is used to execute a prescribed set of PolicyActions on a set of PolicyTargets. The combination of a PolicyExecutionPoint and a PolicyEnforcementPoint enable the act of executing a decision (made by a PolicyDecisionPoint) to be separated from the act of ensuring that the executing actions were performed correctly, and had the desired results.

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: PolicyExecutionPoint

child.name: policyDecisionPoint
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association PXPDirectionDetails

This association end is optional
child.label: policyDecisionPoint

child.name: policyEnforcementPoint
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..*

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association PXPEnforcementDetails

This association end is optional
child.label: policyEnforcementPoint

child.name: managedEntity
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity *

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association PolicyActionPerformedDetails

This association end is optional
child.label: managedEntity
